title: Melania’s Gold
description: Gently sweet, full bodied and with mellow fruity esters, Melania’s Gold had a smooth, easy-drinking quality.

title: Brut La Grande
description: Subtly nuanced with wisps of fruit and spice — as well as a touch of sweetness — Brut La Grande is indeed 'similar' to a Champagne.

title: Weirding Way
description: A saison fermented with twelve different strains of Brettanomyces and dry-hopped with Citra hops, it boasted a gorgeous hazy appearance and heady aromas of citrus and funk.

title: Slow Death
description: A dark sour beer aged in whiskey barrels with lemon peel and cinnamon.

title: Roswell
description: A lambic-style sour beer that was spontaneously fermented and barrel-aged over the course of about nine months; it was then re-fermented in five batches with five different kinds of fruit: apricot, blackberry, cranberry, guava and raspberry.

title: Safe Word
description: Creamy, comforting and with a full, rich taste smacking of vanilla, coconut, coffee and even some hickory or licorice.

title: Cookies & Cream Achromatic
description: An obnoxiously decadent variant of Weldwerks' stellar Achromatic imperial stout series of pastry beers, Cookies & Cream was brewed with lactose, cocoa nibs, vanilla beans and, of course, Oreo cookies.

title: Barrel Aged Mountain Standard
description: Barrel Aged Mountain Standard is a 10.6 percent ABV version of Odell’s intensely hoppy Mountain Standard double-black IPA that was aged for more than a year in bourbon barrels.

title: Rum Single Cask Mr. Sandman
description: Aged in a single rum cask, it tastes like a biscuit that had been dipped in rum and covered in chocolate.

title: Nuttiest Professor
description: Sweet, like many barrel-aged behemoths, the peanut smooths it out and mellow it down.

title: Barrel Aged Ryeciprocal
description: Chewy, full and with a satiny mouthfeel.

title: Here Be Monsters
description: Dripping with chocolate cake, vanilla, toffee and fudge, it's creamy and warming from start to finish.

title: Medianoche
description: Striking the perfect balance between a roasty richness and smooth sweetness, it shows off a mature, robust flavor that will make you skip dessert.

title: Strawberry Saison
description: Smooth, crisp and with just enough sweetness from the strawberries to balance the saison yeast.

title: Hickory Peach Wee Heavy
description: For starters, you have to like hickory. If you do, then you’ll enjoy its strong flavor, rounded out by a healthy dose of roasted and smoked peaches. 'Partially caramelized by hot stones, this beer is a fruit tree in liquid form,' the brewery says.

title: Four Grains in the Membrane
description: Barley, rye, wheat and corn — and then aged it in three Laws bourbon barrels.

title: Jimmy Buffett Problem
description: IPA that was aged in both rum and bourbon barrels with pineapple purée and shaved coconut. Light, mellow and subtle but also rich and complex, the beer manages to do a masterful job combining all of these things so that no one flavor or characteristic overtakes the other.

title: Oaked Weissenbock
description: A rich, malty tongue-coater that offered clear notes of banana from the yeast and oak from the first-use barrels, along with some toffee and bubble-gum flavors that rounded it all out.

title: Baltic Porter
description: Light, crispy cracker with ever-so-delicate inflections of chocolate, roastiness and California dates.

title: Lichtenhainer
description: A sour funk as well as a crispness that was salty, light and complex.
